description.narrative:
(i) Spur Regional Economic Growth through a South-South Investment: Haid's cross-border investments in Vietnam, India and potentially other emerging markets will help to stimulate regional integration, job creation, and economic development through upstream and downstream linkages.
(ii) Improve Farmer Incomes: Aqua feed and fingerlings supplied by Haid to independent shrimp and fish farmers have been shown to generate better feed conversion ratios than those from other suppliers. The use of these inputs and the accompanying technical services from Haid will enhance the supply chain efficiencies and lower inputs costs for farmers, thus contributing to improved farmer incomes.
(iii) Support Climate Change Agenda: The Project will also contribute to the development of Climate Smart Agriculture and climate change adaptation through better efficiencies, reduced waste, and lower fish and shrimp mortality. These all jointly result in a smaller environmental footprint of aquaculture and higher water quality in the ponds, which is especially relevant in markets experiencing a strain on the environment.
(iv) Food Safety: Haid will adopt best food safety practices in the new markets, in line with its current operations that are subject to several Quality Assurance systems (such as ISO22000, BAP, Global GAP and HACCP). These certifications not only mitigate risks but give the Company a competitive advantage.

mailing-address.narrative: Haid International Group Limited Overseas Chief Finance Officer dingbl@haid.com.cn Block A05, Duc Hoa 1 Industrial Park, Hamlet 5, Duc Hoa Dong Commue, Duc Hoa Distr, Long An Province, Viet Nam www.shenglongbt.com

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
